What is Sponge Applicators?
Sponge applicators are sterile sponges attached to handles, used to apply antiseptic solution to the skin. They are commonly used to apply antiseptic solution to puncture sites for disinfection.
I just start,what should I do first?

As you just started, the first thing you should do is to open the tray in a sterile fashion. Ensure you open it carefully to avoid contaminating any of the contents inside. Peel back the packaging, making sure to open it in an area that allows for creating a sterile field. Remember to only touch the very edges and corners of the paper wrapping, not the middle, to prevent contamination. Be cautious as you open the last part, making sure not to touch the contents. conversations.content: What is first three step I need to do?

content.Question_answer: The first three steps you need to do for the lumbar puncture procedure are: 1) Open the lumbar puncture tray in a sterile fashion, ensuring the contents remain uncontaminated. 2) Palpate and identify the correct puncture site by drawing an imaginary line between the two iliac crests and marking the midline. 3) Sterilize the skin by soaking a sponge in povidone-iodine solution and cleaning the puncture site in a circular motion, sterilizing a six to eight-inch diameter area.

conversations.content: What should I do after drawing Iodine?

content.Question_answer: After drawing iodine on the target area three times for sterilization, the next step is to put a towel and then a drape over the sterilized area to maintain a sterile field.
